```{r}
#| label: setup 
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(scales)

usedata <- read_csv("motor_theft_chicago_2001-now.csv")

usedata |> ggplot(aes(x = Year, fill = Arrest)) + geom_bar(color = "black", width = 1, stat = "count") + scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) + scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013,2014,2015,2016,2017,2018,2019,2020,2021,2022,2023,2024)) +  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90, hjust=1)) + labs(title = "Auto Theft in Chicago from 2001 to Present", subtitle = "Most cases did not lead to arrests and the overall number of cases were decreasing but they strted to increase gain in 2022.", x = "Year (starting in 2001)", y = "Number of Cases", caption = "Source: data.cityofchicago.org")
```
